summary: This Skyrim mod installs DCR Blade Set Reloaded. The DCR mods for Skyrim are a continuation of the original Dark Crusader content from Oblivion.
descriptionHtml:
[center][img]http://static-3.nexusmods.com/15/images/110/1566738-1408901851.png[/img]﻿[/center]
[center][youtube]C55cBj6O5gk[/youtube][/center]
[center][youtube]6NAfYjpU6VU[/youtube][/center]
[center][youtube]dn1TUHdv4TI[/youtube][/center]
[center][youtube]HUp989e1O7M[/youtube][/center]
[center][youtube]Pz9XXFxCATk[/youtube]
[size=3]Seriez[/size][size=3]s: Review starts at 3:37[/size]
[youtube]FC8sh8US2WU[/youtube][/center]

[size=3][b]DCR - Blade Set [/b][color=#ff0000][b]Reloaded[/b][/color], a complete revamp of the original Dark Crusader Reforged - Blade Set![/size]

[color=#f1c232][b]So what comes with the Reloaded version?[/b][/color]
All of the original weapons and enchants you can find in the reloaded version. Dynamis 1H, 2H, and the Defender dagger! Defender also comes with an off hand shield version again too.

In the reloaded version I changed the design of the Defender to a "ballock" dagger. It also has a broken off crucifix tied on by a monk crusader. This is intended to go with the armor set once that's finished.

[color=#f1c232][b]So where can I get these new weapons?[/b][/color]
I decided to go old school with this one, and introduce them to the game via chest. (no crafting) Head to [i]Bloated Mans Grotto.[/i] Search Inside, there will be a chest with the weapons and a note to Acilius 200 years go for some lore if your into that sort of thing.

[i]I was sure to add a few extra weapons just in case you want your companion to rock some serous hardware too. [/i][color=#f1c232]:)[/color]

[color=#f1c232][b]Whats to come next?[/b][/color]
[b]Next is the armor[/b], a teaser of it was used in the title image for this mod. I have no ETA on the armor, but it's high on the list of things to do. Right now its still in the low / high poly block out stages. One thing I will say though is it will be a [i]male [/i]armor set.

Finally is the bow, I've been wanting to create a bow for this mod series since the Oblivion days, and it's still on the agenda.

[color=#f1c232][b]Feedback[/b][/color]
Feedback is much appreciated! If you like the DCR mods, please don't forget to endorse. If you have other comments I'd love to hear them too, I'm always trying to improve my skills and workflow.

[color=#f1c232][b]Special Thanks[/b][/color]
I just wanted to thank [url=https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCf94QgWCuNKmmr5afhulWcw]MCDReviews[/url]﻿, [url=https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCoEjvAplB6GaVJjCAwx3fJA]hodilton[/url], [url=https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCgR1ylpnaIfGLbpEHulOtZA]BDMods[/url], [url=https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVdbzKdOdAYevglAyQcmS2w]Slothability[/url], and [url=https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCBRmzqswNKBPnUZW2df3DPw]VatiWah[/url] for taking the time to create such amazing videos to show off this mod. I'm honored! Also, shout-out to the Nexus modding / gaming community for awesome support, QA bug fixes, and fresh idea's.
author: Angilla
